metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Padding
Padding is used to create space around an element's content, inside of any defined borders.
content.html: Padding is used to create space around an element's content, inside of any defined borders.

content.text: CSS Padding
The CSS padding properties are used to generate space around an element's content, inside of any defined borders.
content.html: The CSS padding properties are used to generate space around an element's content, inside of any defined borders.

content.text: With CSS, you have full control over the padding. There are properties for setting the padding for each side of an element (top, right, bottom, and left).
content.html: With CSS, you have full control over the padding. There are properties for setting the padding for each side of an element (top, right, bottom, and left).

content.text: Padding - Individual Sides
CSS has properties for specifying the padding for each side of an element:
content.html: CSS has properties for specifying the padding for each side of an element:

content.text: All the padding properties can have the following values:
content.html: All the padding properties can have the following values:

content.text: Note: Negative values are not allowed.
content.html: Note: Negative values are not allowed.

content.code_html:
div {
  padding-top: 50px;
  padding-right: 30px;
  padding-bottom: 50px;
  padding-left: 80px;
}

content.text: Padding - Shorthand Property
To shorten the code, it is possible to specify all the padding properties in one property.
content.html: To shorten the code, it is possible to specify all the padding properties in one property.

content.text: The padding property is a shorthand property for the following individual padding properties:
content.html: The padding property is a shorthand property for the following individual padding properties:

content.text: So, here is how it works:
content.html: So, here is how it works:

content.text: If the padding property has four values:
content.html: If the padding property has four values:

content.code_html:
div {
  padding: 25px 50px 75px 100px;
}

content.text: If the padding property has three values:
content.html: If the padding property has three values:

content.code_html:
div {
  padding: 25px 50px 75px;
}

content.text: If the padding property has two values:
content.html: If the padding property has two values:

content.code_html:
div {
  padding: 25px 50px;
}

content.text: If the padding property has one value:
content.html: If the padding property has one value:

content.code_html:
div {
  padding: 25px;
}

content.text: Padding and Element Width
The CSS width property specifies the width of the element's content area. The content area is the portion inside the padding, border, and margin of an element ( the box model ).
content.html: The CSS width property specifies the width of the element's content area. The content area is the portion inside the padding, border, and margin of an element (the box model).

content.text: So, if an element has a specified width, the padding added to that element will be added to the total width of the element. This is often an undesirable result.
content.html: So, if an element has a specified width, the padding added to that element will be added to the total width of the element. This is often an undesirable result.

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 300px;
  padding: 25px;
}

content.text: To keep the width at 300px, no matter the amount of padding, you can use the box-sizing property. This causes the element to maintain its actual width; if you increase the padding, the available content space will decrease.
content.html: To keep the width at 300px, no matter the amount of padding, you can use the box-sizing property. This causes the element to maintain its actual width; if you increase the padding, the available content space will decrease.

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 300px;
  padding: 25px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

content.text: All CSS Padding Properties

content.code_html:
Property Description
padding A shorthand property for setting all the padding properties in one declaration
padding-bottom Sets the bottom padding of an element
padding-left Sets the left padding of an element
padding-right Sets the right padding of an element
padding-top Sets the top padding of an element
